long_description: Computes ROC, AUC and Gini for binary classifiers.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the prediction-actual pairs for a binary classifier.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the prediction-actual pairs for a binary classifier.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.description: Specifies the name for the output table that the function creates. The output_table must not already exist.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name for the output table that the function creates. The output_table must not already exist.

argument_clauses.name: ProbabilityColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the predictions.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the predictions.

argument_clauses.name: ObsColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the actual classes.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the actual classes.

argument_clauses.name: ModelIdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the model or partition identifiers for the ROC curves.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the model or partition identifiers for the ROC curves.

argument_clauses.name: PositiveClass
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the label of the positive class.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the label of the positive class.

argument_clauses.name: NumThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of thresholds for the function to use. The num_threshold must be a NUMERIC value in the range [1, 10000]. The default value is 50. The function uniformly distributes the thresholds between 0 and 1.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of thresholds for the function to use. The num_threshold must be a NUMERIC value in the range [1, 10000]. The default value is 50. The function uniformly distributes the thresholds between 0 and 1.

argument_clauses.name: ROC
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function displays roc values (thresholds, false positive rates, and true positive rates). The default value is 'true'. See the note after the table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function displays ROC values (thresholds, false positive rates, and true positive rates). The default value is 'true'. See the note after the table.

argument_clauses.name: AUC
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function displays the auc calculated from the roc. The default value is 'false'. See the note after the table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function displays the AUC calculated from the ROC. The default value is 'false'. See the note after the table.

argument_clauses.name: GINI
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function displays the gini coefficient calculated from the roc. The default value is 'false'. See the note after the table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function displays the Gini coefficient calculated from the ROC. The default value is 'false'. See the note after the table.
